posts.post_content: You can attack and post-combat play this, so it's pretty much like a fog with some added benefits. Also useful if they have something like an [Alluring Siren](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Alluring Siren) out, and you need to prevent yourself from attacking for a turn.
posts.html:

posts.post_content:
Likely my 3rd favorite card in magic.  
it can absolutely save both you and your permanents! it *even*allows you to fully tap out (even your creatures and artifacts!) during a non-multiplayer game, and get away with it! :)  
  
I have no idea why it has such a low rating! are people now-adays forgetting about SECOND MAIN PHASE!?!? i mean, that's almost always when you're supposed to use it!  
4.5/5; I rated it 5/5 just to get its rating further up  
  
EDIT (AGAIN): thanks @ukkmaster and @lunaravernger i should say, combos with [Panoptic mirror](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Panoptic mirror)\*\*\* that card for that warm, fuzzy, "its nearly impossible for me to lose" feeling haha
